channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Making Hawaii safer, 1 year after the fire. And, Dems embrace 'Tampon Tim'
item.description: Today, Maui residents remember the 102 people who lost their lives one year ago in a massive wildfire. Plus, Harris and Tim Walz continue on their introductory tour as JD Vance shadows them closely.
item.content:encoded:
Today, Maui residents remember the 102 people who lost their lives one year ago in a massive wildfire. Plus, Harris and Tim Walz continue on their introductory tour as JD Vance shadows them closely.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Ukraine must drive Russia troops away from border areas, a Zelenskyy adviser says
item.description: As Ukraine receives new weapons -- such as F-16 fighter jets -- Ukrainian troops struggle to halt a Russian ground offensive in the eastern part of the country.
item.content:encoded: As Ukraine receives new weapons -- such as F-16 fighter jets -- Ukrainian troops struggle to halt a Russian ground offensive in the eastern part of the country.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Democrats' presidential campaign seems to have renewed energy after Harris' VP pick
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Democratic strategist David Axelrod about the energy behind Kamala Harris' campaign, and how Democrats can capitalize on the momentum.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Democratic strategist David Axelrod about the energy behind Kamala Harris' campaign, and how Democrats can capitalize on the momentum.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: A new generation of elite female runners embraces strength over thinness
item.description: As Olympic athletes break records in track & field this week, they're also busting myths about body size and running. This generation of female runners are fueling up for strength and stamina.
item.content:encoded:
As Olympic athletes break records in track & field this week, they're also busting myths about body size and running. This generation of female runners are fueling up for strength and stamina.

(Image credit: Bernat Armangue)
item.dc:creator: Maggie Mertens

item.title: In a surprise attack, Ukraine sends a large force into western Russia
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers appear to be several miles inside Russia’s Kursk region, where they are in several villages. Russia’s top military official says some 1,000 Ukrainian troops are taking part.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian soldiers appear to be several miles inside Russia’s Kursk region, where they are in several villages. Russia’s top military official says some 1,000 Ukrainian troops are taking part.

(Image credit: Acting governor of Kursk region Alexei Smirnov's Telegram channel)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: With the Summer Olympics in full swing, sports anti-doping agencies escalate feud
item.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency has blasted America's anti-doping organization for allowing athletes to compete after using performance enhancing drugs, if they agreed to serve as informants.
item.content:encoded:
The World Anti-Doping Agency has blasted America's anti-doping organization for allowing athletes to compete after using performance enhancing drugs, if they agreed to serve as informants.

(Image credit: Ian Waldie)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: NTSB wraps up 'door plug' hearing. What did the safety board learn?
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board has wrapped up a two-day hearing on the January "door plug" blowout aboard a Boeing 737 Max 9 plane flown by Alaska Airlines.
item.content:encoded: The National Transportation Safety Board has wrapped up a two-day hearing on the January "door plug" blowout aboard a Boeing 737 Max 9 plane flown by Alaska Airlines.
item.dc:creator: David Schaper

item.title: After 1 year, remembering the deadly Maui wildfire
item.description: After 102 people died in wildfires one year ago, Maui’s officials have committed to creating new evacuation routes. But even though the buildings are gone, remaking the map is a harder task.
item.content:encoded: After 102 people died in wildfires one year ago, Maui’s officials have committed to creating new evacuation routes. But even though the buildings are gone, remaking the map is a harder task.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: Organizers cancel Taylor Swift concerts in Vienna over fears of an attack
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks counterterrorism expert Javed Ali about the cancellation of Taylor Swift concerts in Austria after officials uncovered an apparent plot to attack large events.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks counterterrorism expert Javed Ali about the cancellation of Taylor Swift concerts in Austria after officials uncovered an apparent plot to attack large events.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Nobel laureate Yunus arrives in Bangladesh to take over as interim leader
item.description: Muhammad Yunus arrived in Bangladesh from an overseas trip as he looks to restore calm and rebuild the country following an uprising that ended the rule of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.
item.content:encoded:
Muhammad Yunus arrived in Bangladesh from an overseas trip as he looks to restore calm and rebuild the country following an uprising that ended the rule of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

(Image credit: Michel Euler)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
